extendedInfo.description: Conflicts: Fall of Normandy is a turn based strategy game which takes place on the western front during the Second World War immediately after the D-Day invasion on June 6th 1944.You are in command of the German armed forces and you are tasked with stopping the Allied invasion by eliminating all landing beaches in Normandy - while enduring the constant Allied bombardment limiting your mobility. Troops at your disposal range from the fragile Ost battalions to the battle-hardened Waffen SS divisions and Panzer VI formations.FEATURES:+ Long-lasting: Thanks to in-built variation and the game's smart AI technology, each game provides a unique war gaming experience.+ Competitive: Measure your strategy game skills against others fighting for the Hall of Fame top spots.+ Supports casual play: Easy to pick up, leave off, continue later.+ Challenging: Crush your enemy quickly and earn the bragging rights on the forum.+ Settings: Various settings to alter the look of the gaming experience: difficulty levels, what to draw on the map, custom font and map size.+ Experienced units learn new skills, like improved attack or defence performance, ability to cross rivers without losing extra move points.+ A wide variety of units under your command: From weak coastal fortifications, Ost battalions and static infantry units to battle-hardened Waffen SS and Panzer divisions (from Panzer IV to Panzer VI Tigers).+ Historical accuracy: Campaign mirrors the historical setup of the real 1944 Normandy landings - including the divisions that saw combat during the D-Day and the following Normandy Campaign in World War II.+ Tablet friendly strategy game: Automatically scales the map for any physical screen size/resolution from small smartphones to HD tablets, while settings allow you to fine tune hexagon and font sizes.In order to be a victorious general, it is essential that you learn to coordinate your attacks in two ways. First, as adjacent units give support to an attacking unit, keep your units in groups in order to gain local superiority. Secondly, it is rarely the best idea to use brute force when it is possible to encircle the enemy and cut off its supply lines instead.To get a sense of how Conflicts: Fall of Normandy works, try out Operation Barbarossa LITE -- http://bit.ly/GVaC8a -- which uses the same mechanics as Conflicts: Fall of Normandy.Answer the call of duty and join Conflict series on Facebook or Google Plus!+ http://on.fb.me/wsC2QV (FB)+ http://bit.ly/GHHGU1 (G+)Join your fellow strategy gamers in turning the tide of the Second World War!The list below includes the permissions requested and the reasons for their use.+ Internet: To fetch Hall of Fame data from a server.+ Network State: To determine if you are online so the game doesn't crash while trying to connect.+ Control Vibrator: To vibrate the phone during the battles (see settings).

reviews.title: Guilty Pleasure
reviews.comment: Wow.  It\'s scary how much fun it is to throw the Allies back into the sea!  All of Joni\'s games are must-haves, and his customer support is outstanding!
reviews.author: Chip Stockton

reviews.title: fall of normandy
reviews.comment: all games by this writer has hit the nail on the head.ive bought most titles only ones missing are the japs and the sea battles in tha pqciffic theyd b great play on and c what i mean
reviews.author: Mark Loudon

reviews.title: New to Conflicts? Start here!
reviews.comment: I think it\'s well established by now that the Conflicts series is a must for any wargamer with an Android - and this is a great place to start. Not too big and not too difficult, this game clearly favors the German side, but still provides a challenging experience. Addictive and easy to learn, this is a scenario where you\'ll learn to win not by sheer numbers, but by outmaneuvering your enemy, combining your forces and keeping adequate reserves.
reviews.author: George Ross

reviews.title: Shining Light for wargamers on the Android Platform
reviews.comment: Joni\'s games are really pioneering efforts in bringing true historic chit shuffling wargames to the handheld gaming devices. Blazing a trail into many different conflicts through many different eras, he has shown his wargaming engine is more than capable, to bring history soaked entertainment to mobile wargamers. Fall of Normandy is a great introduction to his engine, where very simple user mechanics can build upon one another to form a deep wargaming experience.
reviews.author: Ian Bowes

reviews.title: Good but not the best
reviews.comment: A bit to easy compared to his other games although you can always change the settings to make it more difficult. I do like all his games and this one is no exception :-)
reviews.author: Tim beltman

reviews.title: Another great addition to the conflicts series.
reviews.comment: If you like history, strategy, and good old fashioned tbs games, you\'ll love this developers games.
reviews.author: rob mellor

reviews.title: Fall of Normandy
reviews.comment: Great nostalgic hex based strategy that is hard to find these days on the PC. Hours of fun if yr into this sort of thing. Good challenge as the AI is quite aggressive
reviews.author: Martin Vosper

reviews.title: whoa awesome!
reviews.comment: i beat this on my first time, just group up & charge at the edge beaches it lacked the epic feel of eastern front (which i play for days & cant beat ugh) & i just got civil war & lost twice so far these nuutinen games are just too cool!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great!
reviews.comment: Can\'t get enough of your games.
reviews.author: Mick Burgess

reviews.title: Fall of Normandy 1944
reviews.comment: Joni,  You\'ve done it again. While maintaining the same basic system of play, each game is unique with its own challenges. The AI gets better and better.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: He did it again
reviews.comment: This developer is right on again with his latest release.  All that fans of this series have come to expect.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great Stuff
reviews.comment: More great work. Keep it coming.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Nearly perfect! Tweak it harder for realism!
reviews.comment: Im a veteran video wargammer of 30 years intensive experience. Game is good, but too easy. Should increase slightly 10-15 % allies bombardement effect. Should also add some allies commandos paratroopers units of strenght 1, for defense, and strenght 2 for light offensives. Could also add some naval bombardement effect if landing is failing after a few rounds.
reviews.author: Martin Labelle
